title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab
OB: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the query tab, the children nodes are not listed.
SR:
To reproduce this issue, follow these steps:
1. Create a new data set without a SQL statement.
2. Make sure the new data source has no database/table/column information.
3. Attempt to change the data source for the data set.

Expected behavior: The children nodes should be listed when changing the data source.

Actual behavior: The children nodes are not listed when changing the data source. To see if the issue persists, close the data set editor and reopen it.
